characters.name: Maya
characters.goal: expose the officers who staged a shooting
values: Nothing is more important than protecting the innocent.
Nothing is more important than telling the truth.
Nothing is more important than keeping my word.
characters.conflict: the police union and command staff stonewalling her case blocks Maya by controlling key evidence and allies.
characters.epiphany: Realizes that working strictly by the book empowers corruption and learns to act with courageous flexibility.
characters.one_sentence_summary: Maya, a internal-affairs detective, must expose the officers who staged a shooting despite the police union and command staff stonewalling her case.
characters.one_paragraph_summary: Beginning: Maya commits to expose the officers who staged a shooting (D1). Middle: after a devastating reversal, Maya realizes the old belief was false and must change tactics (D2). End: pressure narrows to one path and forces the final confrontation (D3).

characters.name: Morrison
characters.goal: protect the operation and stop the investigation
values: Nothing is more important than maintaining control.
Nothing is more important than security.
Nothing is more important than my family's future.
characters.conflict: Opposes Maya by withholding resources and deploying corrupt leverage to stop the goal.
characters.epiphany_justification: Believes the ends justify the means; admits no change because control is the only way to survive.
characters.one_sentence_summary: A powerful rival blocks the investigation to keep his empire intact.
characters.one_paragraph_summary: Act I: sets traps that commit the hero (D1). Act II: escalates pressure and reveals the hero's false belief (D2). Act III: forces a single endgame that creates the showdown (D3).

interiority.motive_history: Early failures and threats to his family taught him that control protects those he loves.
interiority.justification: He frames corruption as necessary to provide security and stability.
